N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1160.4 - General provisions governing commercial ground transportation service

State Regulations
(a) Access to
airport. All commercial ground transportation operators are required to obtain
authorization from the NFTA in order to have access to the airport property for
the purpose of providing the transport of persons or property to or from the
terminal in a commercial vehicle. In order to obtain said authorization, a
commercial ground transportation operator must apply to the NFTA for an access
permit and must pay the NFTA the established fees and charges. Access permits
are issued either in the form of a coupon granting the operator a one-time
access privilege or a decal, which is valid for a specified time
period. (b) Solicitation. No person
engaged in providing commercial ground transportation service at the airport
may solicit business at the airport or within the terminal premises, except to
the extent expressly authorized by the NFTA. For purposes hereof, neither the
leasing of a telephone call panel or other advertising display from the NFTA or
its representative, nor activities in compliance with the NFTA's meet and greet
policy, as set forth herein at section
1160.17
of this Part, shall be
deemed to constitute solicitation. (c) Fees and charges. It shall be the policy
of the NFTA to establish and assess appropriate fees and charges to be paid by
commercial ground transportation operators. The fees and charges for
nonconcessionaire commercial ground transportation operators will be
established by tariff, as set forth in section
1160.21
of this Part and will be
reviewed periodically and adjusted from time to time. (d) Rules and regulations. Commercial
vehicles shall strictly comply with all laws and local ordinances which affect
in any way the actions of those engaged in performing commercial ground
transportation at the airport, laws of the State of New York, rules and
regulations of the New York State Department of Transportation applicable to
the operations contemplated herein and rules and regulations of the NFTA
applicable to said operator. Further, commercial ground transportation
operators will procure or cause to be procured all licenses, insurance, permits, and pay all fees therefore necessary for the conduct of operations
contemplated by this policy. Notes
